entry.title: SAP Cloud ERP (S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition) 2602亮点前瞻——寻源和采购
entry.content:
本篇博客展示在 SAP Cloud ERP (S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition) 2602当中寻源和采购版块发布的新功能以及重大变化和须知，将会覆盖以下话题内容：

  • 寻源和合同管理
  • 运营采购
  • 发票管理

寻源和合同管理

在 HTML 版 SAP GUI中编辑采购信息记录

 

通过管理采购信息记录应用，您如今可在HTML 版本 SAP GUI按供应商显示采购信息记录应用中，查看或编辑采购信息记录。

在清单页面的高级标识列中，点击该图标即可查看不支持的功能清单；若需使用这些功能，系统将自动跳转至上述 HTML 版 SAP GUI的应用。该图标仅在那些更适合在《按供应商显示采购信息记录》（HTML 版 SAP GUI）中查看和管理的采购信息记录行项目中显示。

 

 

 

备注栏中的供应商补充信息

通过管理采购信息记录应用，你可在备注栏中为供应商创建、编辑并显示补充信息。

你也可通过配置定义复制规则（SSCUI：104064），将其他对象（如报价请求、采购订单）中的文本内容引用至采购信息记录。有关配置步骤的更多信息，请参见配置你的解决方案。

 

 

运营采购

采购申请状态详情中的收货状态

本次版本更新后，你可在我的采购申请应用内，于采购申请的状态详情中查看收货的处理中状态。

 

 

创建采购申请 - 已弃用

本应用已弃用，建议你尽快切换至替代应用我的采购申请。

采购申请抬头附件至采购订单的传输

本次版本更新后，你可在管理采购申请 - 专业版应用中，通过采购申请抬头层级的附件面板，将文档管理服务（DMS）作为外部文档（标识：SL1）添加至系统。该功能可实现采购申请抬头附件向采购订单的自动传输

 

 

采购申请工作流中的审批人名称展示

本次新增功能后，在采购申请工作流管理应用中，针对采购申请工作流，你可查看下一计划步骤中所有角色对应的实际审批人姓名，涉及角色包括工作流发起人的直属上级、通过 BAdI 确定的代理审批人、发起人的上上级及上一任审批人的直属上级等。

 

收货确认中的已批准采购订单

本次版本更新后，在收货确认应用中，你将仅能查看状态为已批准的采购订单。

以下状态的采购订单将不再在该应用中显示：

・审批中

・外部审批中

・已驳回

 

从采购申请处理应用跳转至采购申请对应的高级版创建采购订单应用

本次版本更新后，在采购申请处理应用中，为含高级字段的采购申请（PR）创建采购订单时，你可直接跳转至高级版创建采购订单应用。

例如，为库存转储类采购申请、销售订单相关采购申请、服务订单相关采购申请等类型的采购申请创建采购订单时，系统将跳转至高级版创建采购订单应用，供你完成后续处理。

 

采购申请中的物料需求计划控制器字段

本次版本更新后，你可在采购申请处理及管理采购申请- 专业版应用中，查看采购申请的MRP控制员字段。

 

 

 

 

采购申请相关应用重命名

应用收货确认 - 新 已正式重命名为收货确认。

 

处理采购申请 - 已弃用

 

本应用已弃用，并将在后续版本中从SAP Fiori 启动页下架。建议你尽快切换至其替代应用处理采购申请。

采购订单的合作伙伴功能

本次新增功能后，你可对采购订单的以下合作伙伴功能执行查看、分配或取消分配操作：

・联系人（标识：AP/CP）

・合同地址（标识：VA/CA）

・货物供应商（标识：WL/GS）

・负责人（标识：ZM/ER）

 

采购订单的工作流模拟

通过管理采购订单工作流应用，你可在清单页面的菜单中选择模拟功能，对审批流程进行模拟操作。

该模拟功能可帮助你验证指定采购订单将匹配哪一条工作流，同时确认是否应用了正确的工作流启动条件。你可借助模拟结果校验工作流的配置是否无误，从而避免因存在多条工作流定义而可能导致的工作流匹配错误问题。

 

发票管理

 

 

总账科目行项目的物料维护

本次新增功能后，高级版创建供应商发票（应用标识：MIRO）及供应商发票管理（应用标识：F0859）应用中，新增了总账科目行项目专用的物料字段。

通过该功能，你可在供应商发票中为总账科目行项目维护物料信息。

 

预付款清账

本功能支持你对供应商发票的预付款清账信息执行录入、编辑与展示操作。

在管理供应商发票（应用标识：F0859）应用的创建供应商发票视图中创建供应商发票时，若添加的采购订单存在预付款清账相关记录，系统将展示新增的预付款清账栏位；你可在该栏位中录入并编辑所有相关的预付款清账信息。

此外，通过供应商发票清单（应用标识：F1060A）应用，以展示模式打开包含带预付款清账信息发票行项目的发票时，系统同样会展示上述新增栏位，且该栏位中将展示所有与预付款清账相关的信息。

entry.title: SAP Cloud ERP (S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition) 2602 亮点前瞻：产品获利能力审核手册
entry.content:
内容摘要

产品获利能力审核手册 (F8348) 将成为包含生产差异的产品获利能力 (W0182) 的继任应用。产品获利能力审核手册 (F8348) 应用主要用于支持销售会计基于单一产品或者产品组进行利润分析。审核手册将是SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 系统下一代普遍使用的分析报表格式，建议大家未来尽快将相关报表切换至对应的审核手册应用。

在 2602 版本中，产品获利能力审核手册 (F8348) 新增了如下功能：

  1. 毛利概览页签中新增了“期间同比”和“相同期间上一年”视图；
  2. 新增支持维度字段“参考凭证类型”，“库存评估类型”和“业务交易类型”；
  3. 新增支持基于“功能货币”显示报表数据；
  4. 新增”注释”功能；
  5. 新增AI辅助业务洞察功能；
  6. 新增市场细分可扩展CDS视图；

 

2602版本中新增功能的详细介绍

 

新增分析视图

产品获利能力审核手册 (F8348) 应用的毛利概览页签中新增了“期间同比”和“相同期间上一年”视图，用于报告数据的比较分析，支持一键切换报表显示视图，节省手工调整显示参数的时间。

“期间同比”视图 (Period Over Period)：报告期间与上一期间数据的比较分析（AI辅助业务洞察功能仅内嵌于“期间同比”视图）。

 

“相同期间上一年”视图 (Same Period Last Year)：报告期间与上年同一期间的比较分析。

 

新增维度字段

产品获利能力审核手册 (F8348) 应用中新增了3个“维度”字段：“参考凭证类型”，“库存评估类型”和“业务交易类型”，用于筛选和显示报表数据。

 

新增货币类型

产品获利能力审核手册 (F8348) 应用中新增支持“FC 功能货币”类型。功能货币是企业主要经济环境所使用的货币，在SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 系统中用于平行货币评估。

 

新增注释功能

审核手册类型的报表应用普遍支持“注释”功能。后续重新打开审核手册，调整到原有报表显示参数执行之后，打开“注释”面板，“页面注释”和“单元格注释”都会自动显示。

“注释”功能分为“页面注释”和“单元格注释”两类，该功能支持对整个报表页面留言，也支持对某一具体的单元格数据提出疑问或者留言建议复核数据等操作，留下的注释可以由其他人解答和回复，促进和优化团队协作。“注释”功能支持后续修改，添加分类，状态和标签等信息，方便后续检索。

页面注释：

 

单元格注释：

 

要添加或者显示注释，需要将IAM应用”我的注释 (F8232_TRAN)” 分配到用户，该IAM应用默认分配至业务目录“分析 – 注释 (SAP_BW_BC_COMMENT_PC)”，该业务目录默认分配至业务角色“员工 (SAP_BR_EMPLOYEE)”。使用 “分析单元格注释 (S_RS_CMT)“ 限制类型，可以按文档存储名称限制对分析单元格注释的访问。

要更改或者删除注释，需要将IAM应用”管理注释 (F8233_TRAN)” 分配到用户，该IAM应用默认分配至业务目录“分析 – 注释管理 (SAP_BW_BC_COMMENT_ADM_PC)”，该业务目录默认分配至业务角色“分析专家 (SAP_BR_ANALYTICS_SPECIALIST)”。使用 “分析单元格注释 (S_RS_CMT)“ 限制类型，可以按文档存储名称限制对分析单元格注释的访问。

 

新增AI辅助业务洞察功能

产品获利能力审核手册 (F8348) 应用中新增AI 辅助业务洞察功能。目前SAP系统在“期间同比”视图中预设了4个业务洞察分析参数：

  1. 按最大边际利润的前 5 个产品组：根据期间同比视图中的边际贡献 II ，查找并解释利润增加最高的五个产品组。
  2. 按最大边际利润的最后 5 个产品组：根据期间同比视图中的边际贡献 II ，查找并解释利润增加最低的五个产品组。
  3. 按最大边际利润的前 5 个产品：根据期间同比视图中的边际贡献 II ，查找并解释利润增加最高的五个产品。
  4. 按最大边际利润的最后 5 个产品：根据期间同比视图中的边际贡献 II ，查找并解释利润增长最低的五个产品。

 

要使用AI 辅助业务洞察功能，需要将IAM应用”审核手册 (F8405_TRAN)” 分配到用户，该IAM应用默认分配至业务目录“分析 – 审核手册业务洞察 (SAP_BW_BC_RVB_ABI_PC)”，该业务目录默认分配至业务角色“员工 (SAP_BR_EMPLOYEE)”。

截止至SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2602 版本，同样支持AI 辅助业务洞察（Financial Business Insights）功能的分析报表应用包括，但不限于：

  1. 成本中心审核手册 (F7763)
  2. 财务报表审核手册 (F8587)
  3. 公司获利能力审核手册（模板） (F8300)
  4. 集团财务报表审核手册 (F6133)
  5. 项目财务手册 – 专业服务 (F7479)
  6. 租赁和不动产会计审核手册 (F8196)
  7. 信用额度分析审核手册 (F8196)

AI辅助业务洞察（Financial Business Insights）目前是一项付费AI服务，您需要购买相应AI Units之后分配权限到具体用户才能正常使用，更多相关信息请参考链接SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, financial business insights。

如果您希望更多了解更多SAP Business AI 相关信息请参考链接：

SAP Discovery Center

Joule in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

 

新增市场细分可扩展CDS视图

产品获利能力审核手册 (F8348) 应用支持关键用户扩展。您可以创建自定义字段，并直接将其扩展至产品获利能力审核手册 (F8348) 应用显示。

         

 

综上所述，产品获利能力审核手册 (F8348) 应用作为包含生产差异的产品获利能力 (W0182) 的继任应用，两者提供的报表功能大致相同。但审核手册格式的报表应用有其显著的优势，包括新增注释功能，添加计算和 Business AI 等新功能，且审核手册式应用提供的报表页面设计会带来全新的用户体验，可灵活调整的报表格式，也可以设置条件格式来筛选特定范围的金额数据。SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 的产品策略中未来也计划推出更多的审核手册式应用，以满足普遍标准的报表需求，建议大家未来更多探索此类应用，体验SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition系统在报表分析功能方面的优化。

业务需求

作为销售代表通过APP:管理销售凭证来完成日常工作任务，可以根据相关筛选条件轻松过滤销售凭证抬头、项目或计划行信息。筛选结果以列表形式显示，便于进行后续操作处理。可以对凭证进行批处理任务，比如批量更改价格，检查信用等。支持快速跳转到相关APP。

业务需求

3. 高级公司间销售-销售套件

6. 销售凭证打印：输出渠道EXTOM

业务需求

新的输出渠道EXTOM可以在销售凭证中使用，这个渠道可以发送数据在XML格式中到外部系统。如果客户使用除Adobe Document Services外的工具来生成打印表单，那么这个渠道就特别有用。

前提配置

7. 新增API配置点

业务需求

配置点

8. 开票偏离过账日期

业务需求

考虑一个常见场景：咨询顾问每周五进项项目服务过账时间确认，但实际开票在次月5日进行。当其中某个周五落入新的过账期间时，合理的做法是使用上月最后一天作为过账日期，但将开票日期设为次月5日。这种设置确保成本（时间确认）和收入（开票金额）都能分配到同一个过账期间。 此外，如果开票后出现争议，可以保留原始发票的开票日期，同时将过账日期调整到当前期间，从而避免开票期间和过账期间不匹配的问题。

系统实现

9. 经典公司间开票应付账款后台处理框架

当交货公司将公司间发票应收账款过账时，输出处理会自动触发相应应付账款到销售公司账户的过账。从销售公司的角度来看，这些应付账款代表交付给客户的货物的供应商发票。为了使此过账机制按预期运行，需要执行特定的设置步骤。

系统目前提供两种方法将代表公司间发票的应付账款过账到销售公司的账户。这两种方法都在公司间发票的输出处理期间触发：

  • 方法1（推荐解决方案）：通过后台处理框架（bgPF），使用输出通道EDI 如果您是首次设置应付账款的自动过账，请使用此方法。

    详细过程请参考：Automatic Posting of Payables to the Selling Company’s Accounts | SAP Help Portal

  • 方法2（即将废弃解决方案）：通过IDoc处理，使用输出通道IDOC 在以前的版本中，这是标准解决方案，但现在不再推荐使用。

10. 客户退货无需退款

业务需求

客户退回第三方供应商提供的免费样品，无需向客户退款，直接退回供应商。

2602版本更新前：

  • 使用后续物流活动0005或0007时，系统强制要求提供退款，即使实际不需要退款
  • 必须先创建退款凭证，然后再拒绝这些退款凭证来完成退款状态
  • 导致系统中产生大量不必要的退款凭证

2602版本更新后：

  • 可以精确控制退款决策，无需创建不必要的退款凭证
  • 确保客户退货的凭证流转清晰、简洁
  • 直接支持无退款的供应商退货流程

entry.title: Auto Packing with Nested Handling Units in Inbound Delivery – SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
Automatic Packing with Nested Handling Units in Inbound Delivery – SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud

  • Nested Handling Units (HUs) mean packing one Handling Unit inside another Handling Unit.
  • For example, cartons packed into a pallet, where each carton and the pallet have their own HU number.

Step 1: Maintain Packaging Material Types. The menu path is shown in the screenshot below.

Note: I have created 2 Packaging Material types:

  • Pallet
  • Carton

Step 2: Define Material group for Packaging Materials

 

  • Created Packing Material groups for Pallet and Carton.

Step 3: Define Allowed Packaging Materials

  • Map the Packing Material Type with the Packing Material Group

  • Note - For Nested HUs, it is mandatory to cross-map Packing Material Types with Packing Material Groups.

This means:

  • Carton groups must allow pallet types, and
  • Pallet groups must allow carton types,
  • so that inner HUs can be packed into outer HUs without errors.

Step 4: Assign Number Range intervals to Packaging Material Type

  • Assign a number range to the created Packing Material Types for the respective plant and storage location.

Step 5: Created packing materials in MM01 using Material Type VERP and assign the relevant Packing Material Group and Pack. Material Type in the “Matl Grp Pack. Matls, Packing Material type” fields under the Basic Data view/Sales: General Plant data. Additionally, assign the appropriate HU Type and also created SFG Material.

In this scenario, two packing materials are created:

  • CARTONBOX with Packing Material Type CARTON
  • PALLET1 with Packing Material Type PALLET
  • 42 with SFG type.

 

Step 6:  Create Packing Instructions using T-Code: POP1

  • Please note that the Handling Unit (HU) number is generated only for the Load Carrier maintained in a Packaging Instruction.
  • As a result, to generate HUs for both cartons and pallets, each must be defined as a Load Carrier. Since a Packaging Instruction can contain only one Load Carrier, separate Packaging Instructions are required for cartons and pallets.
  • Based on this approach, the following Packaging Instructions have been created:

  • Created Packing Instruction “AutoPack”, added Components for Cotton Box.

  • Maintain check profile.

  • Check and save.

  • A separate Packaging Instruction is created for the pallet by adding the PALLET material as Item Category “P” and the AUTOPACK packaging instruction as Item Category “I”. Maintain the required quantities, then check and save.

Step 7: For automatic determination of the Packaging Instruction, create a condition record using T-code POF1.

  • Select “RCPT” standard for Inbound delivery.

  • Assign the SFG material and the ‘PALLET’ Packaging Instruction in the determination record.

Step 8:  Enable Auto Packing in Delivery Types

  • Selected Standard “EL” delivery type for Inbound delivery
  • Enabled “Automatic Packing” and save

The above are the configuration steps. The functional flow is explained below.

  • Created PO by selecting Confirmation key.

  • Create the inbound delivery, select the line item, and click ‘Auto Packing’. The system automatically packs the material.

In this scenario, Material 42 – SFG Material is maintained.

  • Each Carton Box is defined to carry 25 KG of SFG material.
  • Multiple Carton Boxes are then packed into a Pallet, where one pallet contains 4 carton boxes.
  • A Purchase Order is created for 100 KG of 42 SFG material.

During Inbound Delivery Auto Packing, the system performs the packing automatically as follows:

  • 100 KG of SFG material is packed into 4 Carton HUs (25 KG each).
  • These 4 Carton HUs are nested and packed into 1 Pallet HU.

This demonstrates Nested Handling Unit (HU) auto packing, where inner Carton HUs are packed into an outer Pallet HU, and each level is assigned its own HU number automatically by the system.

entry.title: SAP Cloud ERP (S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition) 2602 亮点前瞻
entry.content:
2026年的序幕已经拉开，SAP也在近期推出了崭新的SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2602版本。帮助企业在这个不断演变的科技时代，寻求解决方案以达到执行与战略目标保持一致，还期待能够提升运营效率。那么，作为一名企业领导者，为什么应该考虑采用SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2602来推动您的运营迈向未来呢？以下是我们 SAP Cloud ERP PSCC 团队为您解读的是该版本的一些亮点。您也可以参考Cloud ERP PSCC的负责人 @BeSchulze  发布的英文博客：My highlights of the SAP Cloud ERP 2602 release ，进一步了解SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2602的具体内容。

AI：通过Joule与任务型智能代理将AI融入核心业务流程

在 2602 版本中，我们在持续深化嵌入式 AI 与 Joule 自然交互能力的同时，正式推出了新一代代理式 AI 功能（当前处于Beta发布阶段），致力于在复杂场景中实现多步骤任务的自主规划与执行。

会计应计智能代理（Beta版本)：

通过基于会计准则文件、历史数据和计算值建议应计项目，支持财务团队将工作重心从手动准备转变为集中复核。应计提案直接呈现在“管理应计提案”应用中，并附带清晰的推导解释，帮助总账会计在不失去过程控制的情况下，更有信心地过账应计项目。

Demo Digital Library - Asset Preview Page

生产计划与运营代理 (Beta版本)：

可在“管理生产订单”应用中通过“Joule 发布”按钮启动。该功能可一次性辅助发布多达 20 个订单。代理会自动执行物料可用性（含替代件检查）、工作中心产能及进度验证。若上述条件不满足，代理还会主动建议重新排程工作方案。

Demo Digital Library - Asset Preview Page

有关Beta发布的注册和更多信息，请关注Influence Opportunity Homepage - Customer Influence

关于如何在SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition中激活SAP Business AI功能，请参看以下SAP note：

3651017 - 在 SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 中激活 SAP Business AI 功能 - SAP for Me

更多有关AI创新的详细内容请参考 @Helen_Han 的博客。

供应链与质量管理能力提升

在SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2602中，供应链与质量管理的能力得到了显著提升。供应链管理方面，增强覆盖了物流跨主题、订单承诺、库存管理、库存分析与控制、以及仓库管理等。质量管理方面，则在质量计划、质量检验和质量改进等领域进行了系统性的优化与提升。如下面示例：

库存管理 – 预留

在最新版本更新中，预留操作流程得到了显著增强。用户现在可以通过 “管理预留项目” 应用，直接基于预留创建库存转储过账（移动类型 311），无需手动切换和重复录入。执行转储后，系统自动跳转至 “管理预留物料凭证” 应用进行过账，过账成功后自动生成两条物料凭证：一条发货，一条收货。

 这一增强优化了库存转储与预留管理的整合，减少操作步骤，提升工作效率，并增强业务流程的可追溯性。用户可以快速查看物料凭证详情，轻松获取详细信息，显著提升物料凭证管理的效率和数据可读性。

 

更多供应链管理和质量管理相关的详细内容请参考 @ecco_liu 的博客。

权限自由新体验：直接分配应用给业务角色

在之前的版本中，我们推出了IAM（身份与访问管理）应用程序这个概念，在权限设计上以应用而不是业务目录作为最小单元，给了权限分配极大的灵活性。但是，我们还是需要首先给业务角色分配相应的业务目录，然后在已分配的权限里做调整。

从2602这个版本开始，我们甚至可以直接给业务角色分配IAM应用程序，可以不需要分配业务目录。假设我设计了一个数据迁移的业务角色MIGRATION_USER，我给它分配了一个数据迁移的业务目录，你能看到它能访问数据迁移工具相关的应用，如下所示：

在IAM应用程序页签下，点击右上角的编辑按钮，你可以看到有一个“添加”按钮：

假设我需要我的这个角色的用户在导入数据之后，可以查看销售订单和采购订单的数据，以验证导入的数据是否正确。我可以点击添加按钮，查找相关的IAM应用并添加如下：

你能看到，我直接添加了“显示销售订单”和“显示采购订单”的权限，分配类型为“直接”，也就是我直接添加的权限，而不是通过业务目录分配而得。有了这种方式，对于我们需要配置非常个性化的业务角色将会更加方便。

更多跨技术话题相关的详细内容请参考 @Vincent_Zhu 的博客。

分析报表功能增强

最新S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2602 版本的发布，为分析带来了强大的功能增强，旨在提升可用性、简化工作流程并提供更深刻的业务洞察。这些新功能对于依赖及时准确数据来驱动业务发展的业务分析专家、财务相关业务人员以及决策者尤为重要。以下是这个版本的重要功能：

  • 新应用：日记账分录分析器（新版本）
  • 新应用： 我的注释
  • 视图浏览器增强
  • 审核手册增强
  • 多维分析增强
  • 【重要】CE2602 弃用的CDS 视图

例如上图为本次发布引入了全新的“我的注释”应用，作为管理协作反馈和讨论的集中枢纽，显著提升注释的可见性、可追溯性与处理效率。该应用会实时汇总您在启用注释功能的审核手册应用（Review Booklets）和多维分析（Multidimensional Analysis）应用中创建、复制或回复的注释，便于统一查看与管理。

更多分析报表相关的详细内容请参考 @AngelaDai 的博客。

可拓展性与开发者增强

在SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2602版本中，可拓展性又有了新的变化，在关键用户可拓展性、开发者可拓展性等都带来了新的增强。以下是这个版本的重要变化：

API增强：业务伙伴、成本率、客户退货、贷项凭证等API有变化和增强

BAdI增强：新增了催款通知的BAdI

自定义字段增强：在维护零售站点应用中，有多个新增自定义字段拓展

自定义业务对象APP更新了新的版本，包含如下几点功能：

  • 生成功能齐全且包含用户界面的 RAP（Restful Application Programming） 业务对象
  • 使用实体操作语言（EML）为业务对象添加行为
  • 在自定义业务对象之间创建关联以实现重用
  • 使用变更凭证跟踪自定义业务对象中的更改

更多可拓展性相关的详细内容请参考 @Zhehui_Xia28 的博客。

固定资产部分报废：支持基于购置年度来定义处理顺序

使用

在SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2602版本中，对于更改余额的资产交易，可以参考当前年度购置来区分，并参考上一年度购置来区分。某些交易只能针对当前年度的价值，也可以针对先前年度的价值。

例如，部分报废就是这种情况：如果资产具有来自不同会计年度的多个购置价值，则系统提供的新功能会在进行报废过账时提供考虑这些购置的可能性。这意味着，根据您是想要先报废较旧还是较新的资产余额，这样操作可能会产生不同的折旧金额。

具体的，可以使用“购置年度”选项定义处理顺序

您可以通过在参考部分中选择购置年度字段的选项来影响资产特定过账应用（例如过账资产报废应用）中的处理顺序。

更多财务相关的详细内容请参考 @BobShen 的博客。

寻源和采购

SAP Cloud ERP (S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition) 2602当中寻源和采购版块发布的新功能以及重大变化和须知，将会覆盖以下话题内容：

  • 寻源和合同管理
  • 运营采购
  • 发票管理

本次版本更新后，你可在管理采购申请 - 专业版应用中，通过采购申请抬头层级的附件面板，将文档管理服务（DMS）作为外部文档（标识：SL1）添加至系统。该功能可实现采购申请抬头附件向采购订单的自动传输

entry.title: Artificial Intelligence in SAP Cloud ERP 2602
entry.content:
Welcome to your one-stop shop to learn and share knowledge about SAP's ready-to-run public cloud ERP software solution.   

SAP Cloud ERP is part of SAP Business Suite that brings AI, data, and applications together into a fully integrated system. This community is open for anyone in the cloud ERP ecosystem–customers, partners, and SAP experts.  

In this blog, I’m thrilled to guide you through the latest AI innovations in our SAP Cloud ERP release 2602. This release marks a significant leap forward in our journey to embed reliable, relevant, and responsible AI directly into the core of your ERP. Our goal is simple: to make your work smarter, your decisions faster, and your daily tasks more intuitive.

With our AI co-pilot Joule and a host of new embedded AI capabilities, we're transforming the user experience and delivering tangible business value across every line of business. Let's dive into the highlights!

A Smarter Foundation: Cross-Topic AI Innovations

We're embedding AI into the very fabric of the user experience, making the system more proactive, helpful, and personalized for every user.

1. Situation handling

1.1. AI-assisted situation handling (release 2602.1)

Solve business challenges faster and smarter with AI-powered recommendations:

  • Instant, Personalized Guidance: Get tailored advice right when you need it, helping you resolve business issues quickly and confidently.
  • Flexible and Customizable: Adapt the solution to your unique business logic—make changes easily and keep your processes up to date.
  • Effortless Access to Knowledge: Find the information you need, even beyond SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, with simplified, contextual support.

Key Features:

  • Generate actionable recommendations based on your specific business context.
  • Create and manage prompts to ensure solutions are relevant and effective.
  • Enrich recommendations with data from multiple sources for deeper insights.

With AI-Assisted Situation Handling, you empower your team to work smarter, make better decisions, and stay agile in a fast-changing business environment.

For more information, see: Situation Handling

Discovery Center

 

2. User experience

2.1. AI-assisted error explanation for SAP Fiori elements-based Applications

With AI-assisted error explanations for SAP Fiori elements-based applications, you’ll save valuable time, boost reliability, and make maintenance easier than ever. Faster resolution of errors with the support of generative AI:

  • Speed Up Maintenance: Let generative AI quickly explain errors and recommend solutions, so you spend less time fixing issues and more time driving your business forward.
  • Reduce Future Errors: Understand the root causes behind problems, helping you prevent similar issues from happening again.

For more information, see: Discovery Center

 

2.2. AI-assisted smart personalization of My Home for applications

Tailor My Home experience using natural language and transform your workspace with just a few words:

  • Natural Language Personalization: Simply tell SAP what you need—AI understands your requests and instantly suggests the most relevant apps for your daily tasks.
  • Quick and Easy Setup: Add new applications to your “My Home” in seconds. Preview AI-generated suggestions before confirming, so you always get what fits best.
  • Save Time, Boost Productivity: No more searching through menus. AI streamlines your workflow, making it ideal for both new and occasional users.
  • Trustworthy Recommendations: Rely on intelligent, data-driven suggestions that ensure accuracy and build confidence in your setup.
  • Seamless Experience: Enjoy a smooth, click-minimizing process with a preview-based confirmation—making personalization simple and enjoyable.

Unlock the full potential of SAP Cloud ERP by letting AI tailor your “My Home” to your needs—so you can focus on what matters most

For more information, see: Discovery Center

 

2.3. AI-assisted easy fill of SAP Fiori elements-based applications

Let AI handle the details—just describe what you need, and watch your forms fill themselves:

  • Save Time Instantly: Maintain all the fields on your object pages in seconds, thanks to seamless AI-powered automation.
  • No More Guesswork: Simply use natural language, and the system intelligently matches your words to the right fields—no more hunting through forms.

With AI-assisted easy fill, you’ll breeze through data entry, reduce manual effort, and focus on what matters most in your business.

For more information, see: Discovery Center

 

2.4. AI-assisted task automation (beta)

AI-assisted task automation is the next embedded AI feature in the SAP Fiori user experience of SAP Cloud ERP. It builds on the previously delivered features such as easy filter, easy fill and smart solutions for situations in My Home.​

It allows key users and end users to automate their daily activities in SAP’s Fiori apps by using generative AI to create so called “smart helpers”. Those ”smart helpers” execute the repetitive activities on behalf of the end user either from the SAP Fiori launchpad or from individual SAP Fiori apps while always keeping the user in the loop for decisions on data changes.​

Benefits:

  • Easy to use SAP Fiori application to create “smart helpers”​
  • Full control of what the “smart helper” proposes to do​
  • Intuitive way of running the “smart helper” while being always in control in case of changes​
  • Supports all SAP Fiori elements-based applications​

Key features:

  • Creation of “smart helpers” based on all available SAP Fiori elements-based applications in SAP Cloud ERP​
  • Generation and validation of execution plan for “smart helpers”​
  • Run time for “smart helpers” is integrated into My Home the product homepage of SAP Cloud ERP​

Please register to be part of the SAP Beta Testing of the Newest AI Innovations in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

 

2.5. AI-assisted smart solution for situations (beta)

AI-assisted smart solution for situations in My Home simplifies workflows by dynamically adapting the user interface to guide business users through resolution steps using the power of generative AI

Directly on the SAP Cloud ERP homepage, users can resolve operational situations in just a few clicks. AI-driven recommendations accelerate decision-making and streamline user actions for improved efficiency

Benefits:

  • Drives time efficiency by eliminating navigation through intelligent UI design
  • Enhances decision-making with timely, context-aware AI recommendations
  • Delivers trustworthy AI-generated results, built on enterprise-grade intelligence
  • Offers an intuitive, click-efficient experience, empowering users to act confidently with minimal effort.

Key features:

  • Key information and actions are surfaced through dynamic cards reducing the need for in-depth navigation
  • Enables one-click resolution of situations directly from the homepage thereby enhancing operational efficiency within SAP Cloud ERP
  • Situation types supported:
  • End date for project reached but stage not completed
  • Alert for bank messages
  • Expiring Sales Quotations

Please register to be part of the SAP Beta Testing of the Newest AI Innovations in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

 

AI Innovations Across Lines of Business:

3. Finance

3.1. Accounting Accruals agent (beta)

Close Your Books Faster with the AI-Powered Accounting Accruals Agent

The agent helps accountants to automate journal entry preparation for accruals by analyzing historical data and leveraging accounting policy documents. It calculates accurate amounts and provides a pre-populated list of journal entries for review and confirmation. Your accounts will increase their productivity, ensure timely month-end close, and get more time for high-value activities.

  • Automate Journal Entries: Let AI handle the heavy lifting by preparing accrual journal entries for you—twice as fast as before.
  • Boost Accuracy: The agent analyzes your historical data and accounting policies to calculate precise accrual amounts, reducing errors and manual work.
  • Ready-to-Review Entries: Receive a pre-populated list of journal entries, so your team can quickly review and confirm, saving valuable time.
  • Focus on What Matters: Free up your accountants to concentrate on high-value activities, ensuring a timely and efficient month-end close.

Business Impact:

  • Cut time spent on accrual calculations and deferrals by up to 80%
  • Reduce review and posting time by 50%
  • Achieve a faster, smoother period-end close

For more information, see: Discovery Center

 

3.2. International trade classification agent (beta)

Classify your products for international shipping in seconds—no expertise required

This agent helps product classification specialists to classify goods for shipping. The agent reasons over product characteristics and trade regulations and acts to classify goods for international shipping. The agent recommends customs tariff numbers and commodity codes, providing rationale for easy review and approval.

This agent will help ensure compliance with global trade regulations and reduce the risk of manual errors with robust governance and a clear, audit-ready decision

  • Automatic Classification: Let AI analyze your product details and trade regulations to instantly recommend the right customs tariff numbers and commodity codes.
  • Ensure Compliance: Rely on recommendations that are reasoned from both product characteristics and up-to-date trade rules, helping you meet global regulations with confidence.
  • Reduce Risk: Eliminate manual errors with a robust, auditable decision process—every classification comes with clear rationale for easy review and approval.

Business Impact:

  • 50% reduction in effort to classify international trade products

For more information, see: Discovery Center

 

3.3. Sales accounting: period comparisons and business insights for Product Profitability Review Booklet

The Product Profitability Review Booklet enables you, as a Sales Accountant, to analyze the profitability for products sold using built-in business pages for the Margin Overview and the Cost of Goods Sold (COGS) Breakdown.

Benefits:

  • Gain deeper insights into margins and cost of goods sold (COGS) with period comparisons
  • Enable informed decision-making with AI-enabled financial business insights
  • Support flexible market segment analysis with an extensible CDS view
  • Improve visibility with additional currency types and dimensions

Key features:

Enhancements to the Product Profitability Review Booklet app that:

  • Provide new period comparisons for product profitability
  • Use AI to generate financial business insights into period comparisons for product profitability
  • Add a commenting feature
  • Display results in functional currency
  • Enable CDS view to support extensibility for market segment
  • Incorporate additional dimensions and navigation targets

For more information, see: Enhancements in the Product Profitability Review Booklet.

 

3.4. SAP Multi-Bank Connectivity: Using Joule to access solution-related content 

Have a question about SAP Multi-Bank Connectivity? Whether you’re curious about features, setup steps, or integration scenarios, Joule is here to help! With Joule, you can simply ask your question in natural language—no technical jargon needed. Joule instantly searches the SAP Help Portal, analyzes the latest resources, and delivers clear, context-aware answers tailored to your needs.

Benefits:

  • Ask Naturally, Get Answers Instantly: Express your business needs in your own words and receive quick, relevant guidance.
  • Faster Self-Service: Get crisp, summarized content so you can resolve issues or learn new features without digging through documentation.
  • Save Time: Joule streamlines your search, helping you find the right information faster so you can focus on your work.

Key features:

  • Smart Search & Summaries: Joule scans SAP Help Portal documentation and summarizes the most important details about SAP Multi-Bank Connectivity processes and features.
  • Easy Deep Dives: Need more detail? Joule provides direct links to the original documentation for further exploration.

For more information, see: Joule with SAP Multi-Bank Connectivity | SAP Help Portal

 

3.5. SAP Green Ledger: Joule for reporting: AI-assisted carbon emission analysis (09/2025)

Instantly Visualize and Understand Your Carbon Data with Joule in SAP Green Ledger

Joule in Green Ledger can generate charts from carbon data through conversational prompts, providing automatic visualizations for reporting purposes. This tool is useful for efficiently analyzing and presenting carbon data in a clear and intuitive format.

Benefits:

  • Actionable Insights for Sustainability: Instantly see trends and breakdowns in your greenhouse gas emissions, empowering you to make smarter decisions for carbon reduction and long-term success.
  • Save Time, Focus on Strategy: Automated reporting means less manual work and more time for impactful analysis and decision-making.
  • Effortless for Everyone: The intuitive interface makes advanced carbon reporting accessible to all users, regardless of technical background.

Key features:

  • Tailored Visualizations: Generate column, donut, and line charts from carbon data, customized to your business needs and reporting requirements.
  • Support for Multiple Dimensions: Analyze data by GHG category, GHG scope, fiscal year, and more, with carbon emissions as the primary measure. 
  • Smart Context Handling: Joule understands follow-up questions, so you can keep exploring your data without starting over

For more information, see SAP Green Ledger, carbon emission analysis in SAP Discovery Center.

 

3.6. SAP Document and Reporting Compliance: AI-assisted trend analysis and summary for reports (beta)

The Trend Analysis feature in Joule provides natural language interaction to help you analyze VAT returns. You can ask Joule to generate comparative trend reports and detect outliers. Joule delivers insights that make VAT reporting faster, more accurate, and easier to understand.

Joule can also summarize the generated reports, helping you review key trends and results quickly. This makes it easier to identify anomalies and support faster approvals.

Benefits:

  • Accelerates VAT review and approval cycles: Natural-language trend analysis and auto-summarized insights reduce the time required to interpret VAT data across periods, enabling faster reviews, quicker approvals, and shorter reporting cycles.
  • Improves accuracy and reduces compliance risk: Automated detection of trends, fluctuations, and outliers helps identify anomalies early, minimizing manual errors and lowering the risk of incorrect filings or regulatory non-compliance.
  • Enables informed, data-driven decision-making: Clear, comparable trend reports and concise summaries transform complex VAT data into actionable insights, helping finance and compliance teams make confident decisions with less effort.

Key features:

  • Use Joule to generate a trend analysis for a VAT return across multiple reporting periods. The analysis highlights key trends, fluctuations, and irregularities, and flags values that deviate from expected norms to help you identify potential errors or compliance risks.
  • Joule generates a concise summary of key VAT insights to support faster reviews, approvals, and decision-making.

 

3.7. SAP Enterprise Threat Detection, Cloud Edition: intelligent alert handling and investigation recommendations

Investigations are the central entities to examine security incidents in SAP Enterprise Threat Detection, cloud edition. Intelligent recommendations automatically add case-specific response and mitigation recommendations to investigations based on predefined value lists and machine learning functionality. 

Benefits:

  • Decrease manual effort and increase efficiency for SAP monitoring agents

Key features:

  • Automated Recommendations: The system uses predefined value lists and machine learning to generate tailored recommendations for each investigation.
  • Guided Investigation Preparation: SAP monitoring agents are supported with automatic recommendations when compiling investigation results and suggestions for customers.
  • Standardized Response Generation: Recommendations are based on standard operating procedures for the detected alert patterns, ensuring consistency and reliability in incident response

For more information, see: Generating Investigation Recommendations

 

Sales

4.1. Automatic creation of sales orders from unstructured data (premium)

Internal sales representatives can create sales orders from purchase order files in PDF or image formats (unstructured data). After a file is uploaded, the system automatically extracts file information into a sales order request and proposes values for sales order request fields (for example, by determining the sold-to party based on extracted data). The sales order request can later be converted into a sales order.

Benefits:

  • Increase sales force efficiency through the automatic creation of sales orders from unstructured data
  • Reduce manual effort

Key features:

  • Automatic Data Extraction: Instantly extract and populate sales order details from unstructured files like PDFs and images
  • Intelligent Field Suggestions: The system proposes values for sales order fields, such as the sold-to party, based on the extracted data.
  • Multilanguage Support: SAP Document AI enables extraction and training in multiple languages, making the solution accessible for global teams.

For more information, see: Create sales orders from unstructured data

 

Procurement

5.1. Conversational search for local and central purchase requisition status (Release 2510)

Designed for casual users, who easily and quickly want to inform themselves about the status of their purchase requisition, the intelligent Joule assistant can be queried to fetch the follow-on document status of a requestor’s self-service purchase requisition

Benefits:

  • Provide quicker and easier access to the purchase requisition and follow-on document status

Key features:

  • Query Joule for the approval and follow-on document status of a given local or central purchase requisition without the need to navigate into the details of another SAP Fiori app
  • Enter any of the related document numbers—for example, local or central requisition number, purchase requisition number in the connected system, or cart number in SAP Ariba—when asking for the document status

 

Asset Management

6.1. Maintenance notification creation and screening with Joule (release 2602)

SAP Cloud ERP 2602 makes asset management easier for everyone.

Now, you can quickly create maintenance notifications just by telling Joule—using simple, everyday language—what the issue is, which equipment it affects, and how urgent it is. All your notifications are managed in the new SAP Fiori app, where you can easily follow up and turn them into maintenance orders with just a few clicks. This update makes reporting problems faster, reduces downtime, and takes the hassle out of routine maintenance tasks.

Benefits:

  • Simplified Maintenance Processes: Create maintenance notifications quickly and easily using natural language, reducing the complexity of traditional workflows
  • Faster Fault and Incident Response: Accelerate the reporting and handling of maintenance issues, enabling quicker resolution and less downtime.
  • Increased Efficiency: Streamline operations and boost productivity by leveraging AI-driven automation for routine asset management tasks.

 

Key features:

  • AI-Assisted Notification Creation: Use Joule to generate maintenance notifications by simply providing key details (description, technical object, priority) in natural language.
  • Integration with SAP Fiori App: Access and manage created notifications directly in the new SAP Fiori app “Manage Maintenance Notification (F5777)”
  • Conversational Order Creation: Accept requests and convert notifications into maintenance orders within a single conversational context.
  • Natural Language Processing: Perform operations and interact with the system using everyday language, making the process faster and more accessible.

For more information, see: What’s new for Joule – SAP Help Portal

 

Manufacturing

7.1. AI-assisted production routing proposal and copy routing (release 2602)

Save time and reduce errors by letting AI do the heavy lifting! Now, you can quickly generate new production routings by reusing existing ones—no more repetitive data entry.

Benefits:

  • Streamlined Process: Production engineers, planners, and master data specialists can easily create and edit routings, ensuring consistency and accuracy every time.

Key features: 

  • Use AI to find similar routing based on material name, description, and bill of material to propose close matches
  • Get recommendations of routing that you can copy or reuse, based on similarity
  • Copy and edit the proposed routing to arrive at the new routing

​As a prerequisite, you need to enable the related ISLM scenario. For information on setting up the ISLM scenario, see this blog post. For general information on ISLM, see: Intelligent Scenario Management.

For more information, see:

  • Intelligent Scenario to Find Similar Materials for Routing Proposal
  • Create a Routing using the AI-Assisted Material Search

 

7.2. Manage production orders - Production Planning and Operations agent (beta)

With this feature, you can start the Production Planning and Operations agent from the worklist of the Manage Production Orders app. The app now includes the Joule Release button that enables you to release your production orders assisted by agentic AI technology.

Benefits:

  • Reduce manual work with automated validation of material, capacity, and scheduling availability
  • Keep production moving with recommended workarounds for material and scheduling conflicts
  • Boost production throughput by cutting order-processing delays and minimizing downtime between order releases

Key features:

  • Assisting the production planners and supervisors in releasing up to 20 production orders at a time.
  • The agent automates prerequisite checks necessary for releasing production orders, including component availability and alternatives as well as work center capacity checks.
  • The agent also proposes rescheduling when the prerequisites for release are not met.
  • Once all criteria are met, the planner can confirm the proposed order changes, and the agent will complete the production order release.

Clearer Source Citations
SAP Joule for Consultants now makes it easier to see where information comes from. Citations are more visible and, when relevant, include results from public web searches. This gives you a transparent view of the sources behind every answer, helping you trust and verify the information you receive.

entry.title: A simplified approach to choosing between S/4HANA Public Cloud vs S/4HANA Private Cloud
entry.content:
One of the fundamental decisions that organisations are facing as they plan their transition to Cloud ERP, is the deployment option to choose. In SAP terms the question becomes: Would S/4HANA Public Cloud or S/4HANA Private Cloud be the better choice?

At high level, S/4HANA Public Cloud is a "ready-to-run" solution prioritizing standardization and deployment speed, while S/4HANA Private Cloud is a "tailored-to-fit" solution enabling flexibility and customization. In reality, the selection between the two is more complex with different parameters to consider. This article aims to ease the decision process through a simplified approach.

The right deployment option could, and most often should, be subject to a series of workshops and careful assessment of an organisation's specific needs. Still, experience from customer engagements has enabled me to develop a simplified approach which helps provide initial steering.

Overall, where possible, S/4HANA Public Cloud should be the ultimate destination. This due to its unique qualities, including faster access to innovation, a simpler Cloud operating model and reduced Total Cost of Ownership (TCO). On the flip side, Public Cloud also comes with limitations as compared to S/4HANA Private Cloud. These include a narrower implementation scope, reduced system control and the need to leave customisations and certain data behind.

To simplify the decision, as a rule of thumb an organisation should opt for S/4HANA Public Cloud if the following three elements match their needs:

  • S/4HANA Public Cloud implementation scope. Public Cloud offers  broad functionality covering the needs of most organizations and is becoming constantly richer in scope. Still, some functionality such as industry-specific scenarios may be unique to Private Cloud. The way to confirm that Public Cloud vs Private Cloud is fit for purpose is by completing the SAP Digital Discovery Assessment in collaboration with SAP or your Partner.
  • New implementation as migration option. A migration to Public Cloud can be completed only via a new implementation, while a migration to Private Cloud can also be completed via a system conversion or Selective Data transition for organisations on a legacy SAP ERP system. If you are new to SAP, then a new implementation is your clear way forward. If you are moving from a legacy SAP ERP system though, then it is key to validate that a new implementation is right for you. A new implementation requires that custom code and custom processes from your legacy SAP ERP system are left behind - which could actually be an opportunity for moving to a Clean Core and reinventing business processes using SAP's Best Practices. A new implementation also requires that previous transactional data aka closed items are left behind e.g. archived, otherwise maintained in the legacy ERP system (online as read-only or offline as a backup/image). Unless there is a specific need to bring closed items to the new Cloud ERP environment, leaving these behind helps run a lighter, easier to maintain and more cost-efficient system.
  • Public Cloud Operating model. Public Cloud is equivalent to SaaS, as opposed to Private Cloud which is similar to IaaS/PaaS. This means that Public Cloud is highly standardised, enabling rapid innovation at a lower TCO, offering a Clean Core and SAP‑controlled operations and allowing the customer to focus on what matters to them most. It comes with Application Management Services included, therefore, among others, SAP is taking care of  application management including release updates and Middleware. Still, in Public Cloud, extensibility options are limited (classic ABAP extensibility not possible), the customer has no control over release upgrades (these are mandatory without the option to postpone and with a time-restricted regression testing window), and has no control over infrastructure choices either (no Hyperscaler selection). If the organisation has a particular requirement for any of these or for an overall operating model of shared responsibility with SAP, then Private Cloud might be better suited.

    While the above three elements focus mostly on the technical aspects of the deployment option decision, it comes without saying that the company's culture is also a major decisive factor. The appetite to reimagine processes and outsource a large part of IT operations to the software vendor while re-focusing on innovation activities, are of paramount importance for a Public Cloud deployment.

    All that said, the value and fit of Private Cloud for certain organisations should not be overlooked. Many enterprises, especially those with regulatory constraints, multi‑layered integrations, high customisation, heavy data volumes, or deep industry-specific implementation scope, continue to find Private Cloud more practical and in cases the only suitable option.

    To summarise, if you are an organisation planning a transition to SAP’s Cloud ERP and considering your deployment option, your actionable next steps are as follows: complete the SAP Digital Discovery Assessment to confirm whether the scope of S/4HANA Public Cloud matches your functionality needs, evaluate whether a new implementation vs system conversion is fit for purpose, and assess whether the Public Cloud operating model suits you. If the answer to all three questions is yes, and you establish the right company culture, then lead with S/4HANA Public Cloud. Otherwise, in case of unique requirements and a more complex landscape, S/4HANA Private Cloud might be a better fit. 

    Disclaimer: The approach suggested in this article reflects my views based on experience from working with different organizations, rather than SAP's official views. It aims to provide simplified guidelines and initial steering, but does not replace the need for more thorough assessment.

entry.title: Configuring SAP GRDC Connection to SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud — Step-by-Step Guide Part 1
entry.content:
Table of contents

  1. Introduction
  2. High-level architecture and token flow
  3. Prerequisites
  4. Step 1 — Provision and configure IAS (Identity Authentication Service)
  5. Step 2 — Configure trust between BTP subaccount and IAS
  6. Step 3 — Prepare the S/4HANA Cloud side (Users and Communication)
  7. Step 4 — Prepare the BTP Side (Users and Destinations)
  8. Step 5 — Deploy & test the GRDC app against S/4HANA Cloud
  9. How to request Consulting
  10. References & further reading

1. Introduction

Integrating SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) apps with S/4HANA Public Cloud securely requires configuring identity, trust, and connectivity so API calls from the app are authenticated and authorized in S/4HANA and vice versa. The Group Reporting Data Collection app (GRDC) is a SAP BTP-hosted solution commonly used to collect financial and non-financial data for S/4HANA Group Reporting. This guide focuses on a straightforward set up of the technical connection. SAP recommends using Principal Propagation which means it forwards the end-user identity from across the different layers to S/4HANA that will apply user-based authorization.

 Goals:

  • Configure IAS as the IdP for authentication first, then add a Custom IdP
  • Configure trust (metadata exchange) between IAS and BTP
  • Prepare the S/4HANA Public Cloud Communication Scenarios
  • Create destinations in BTP to call S/4HANA Public Cloud Communication Scenarios
  • Test GRDC Apps
  • Describe Common Errors and Pitfalls (Part 2 of this Blog)

2. High-level architecture & token flow

Overview:

Applications in SAP BTP do not store user information. Instead, the applications redirect the authentication to an Identity Provider. 

For SAP BTP, there are several options for authentication , of which  SAP ID Service and SAP Cloud Identity Authentication service (IAS) come with a BTP subscription. SAP ID service is the default identity provider for both platform users and business users (in applications) at SAP BTP. You can start using it without further configuration.

We strongly recommend that you configure your custom tenant of SAP Cloud Identity Services as the identity provider and connect SAP Cloud Identity Services to your own corporate identity provider. This topic needs to be adressed before the project, for testing purposes you can also start with the Default Identity Provider from SAP BTP .

Common flows used for SAP Group Reporting Data Collection:

  • OAuth2 SAML Bearer Assertion (OAuth2SAMLBearerAssertion): the BTP app requests token and uses SAML assertion to get an S/4HANA access token.
 

This picture should show the high level architecture, the yellow points refer to steps in the Administration Guide which have a different numbering than this Blog  Source: SAP Help

3. Prerequisites

Before starting the configuration, verify the following prerequisites. You will need possibly different personas with different roles and access. 

  • SAP BTP global account and a subaccount with Cloud Foundry where GRDC is provisioned. The Subscription has the correct entitlements.
  • SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud:  Scopes are activated for SAP Group Reporting
  • The following scopes need to be activated for Group Reporting: 1SG  https://me.sap.com/processnavigator/globalSearch/1SG.
  • For GRDC Integration activate Scope 287 https://me.sap.com/processnavigator/globalSearch/287
  • Setting Up Users S/4HANA Public Cloud, see this blog User Management in a nutshell for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
  • SAP Identity Authentication Service (IAS) tenant (trial or productive) — or access to the customer’s IAS tenant.
  • Roles and permissions of users doing configuration steps:
    • BTP subaccount: Org & Space admin or subaccount admin to configure trust and destinations
    • S/4HANA Public Cloud: Admin role that can create Communication Arrangements and Communication Systems
    • S/4HANA Public Cloud: Admin role that can create Business Roles from Templates
    • S/4HANA Public Cloud: Admin role that can create Business Users and assign Roles
    • IAS admin (Custom IdP Admin): ability to configure identity providers, trust and user stores
  • Basic knowledge of OAuth2 / SAML concepts and SAP BTP Destination service eg. by BTP Onboarding Training

4. Step 1 — Provision and configure IAS (Identity Authentication Service)

With each SAP BTP provision there is a default identity tenant included which has also delivered users to start. Global Accounts come connected to SAP ID Service at the Identity Provider. However, it is recommended to set up a custom IdP for identity authentication via IAS. (Identity Authentication Service). For many customers, business users might be stored in corporate identity providers.

SAP recommends using SAP Cloud Identity Services - Identity Authentication Service (IAS)  as a hub.

  1. Create or access an IAS tenant using SAP BTP cockpit.
  2. Choose Establish Trust.
  3. The Configure Tenant wizard opens.
  4. Choose the SAP Cloud Identity Services tenant and choose Next. The identity providers listed are the SAP Cloud Identity Services tenants associated with your customer ID

5. Step 2.1 — Configure trust between BTP subaccount and IAS

Settings on the Identity Provider

Configuring an IdP to supply identity to applications on a subaccount is basically a two-step process to setup a mutual Trust via an exchange of SAML metadata artifacts.

As a first step, go to BTP Cockpit and take the SAML metadata from the Subaccount that was provisioned.

The 'Trust Configuration' section has a button to download the SAML Metadata. Click on this button and locally save the XML representation of the metadata file.

Now, head over to the Administration page of your IAS tenant to configure the artifact that was downloaded. 

The 2 important sections here that need to be configured are

a) Configurations to setup the SAML Service Provider (SAP BTP)

b) Subject Name identifier (which is a user profile attribute to uniquely identify and authenticate users between applications)

Import the SAML metadata file downloaded in the previous step

Choose a subject name identifier that is known and provided in the IAS/IdP on BTP and on S/4HANA, public edition Side.

The choice significantly impacts authentication success, as any mismatch between the SAML assertion's NameID and the S/4HANA user identifier will result in authentication failure. The authentication type used for the GRDC connection will be OAuth SAML Bearer Assertion .

Where as BTP has several possibilities (user ID, loginame or email) , from S/4HANA Public Edition side there are only two:

S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition expects the Subject Name Identifier has to be set to "Login Name" or "Email address": Do not use user ID.  

If you use Login Name as subject name identifier, it will match the User Name of the Business User on S/4HANA Public Cloud side with Login name of the User on BTP side.

If you use email as subject name identifier, it will match the email of the Business Useron S/4HANA Public Cloud side with email of the User on BTP side.

We will create users on BTP side and S/4HANA Public Cloud side in Step 6 where this information is maintained. After that in step 7 the technical link will be configured in the BTP destination. For now, you need to decide which of the two options you go for in alignment with your overall IDP strategy for user logon.

5. Step 2.2 — Configure trust between BTP subaccount and Custom IdP

When you have set up a custom IdP and the same way as for the default IAS you have now these possibilities for trust configuration:

Flag this custom Identity Provider as „Available for User logon“ 

Possible Pitfall: Several Identity Provider have a Flag set for “Available for User Logon”. Choose only one Identity Provider to be available for logon.

-Add test users to the IdP or connect an external user store (e.g., corporate IdP via SAML or SCIM provisioning via IPS).-

 

6. Step 3.1. — Prepare the S/4HANA Public Cloud side with Business Users and Business Roles

  1. Log into your SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud tenant with an admin role.
  2. Enter the App Maintain Business Roles. Create a Custom Role by copying a delivered SAP Role
 
Do this for the following Roles for our first testing. After that you will need to refine the role usage depending on the business requirements.

 

SAP_BR_ADMINISTRATOR_GRP

SAP_BR_GL_ACCOUNTANT_GRP

Now you have created Group Reporting Data Collection related Roles

Next step is to create business users via the app: Maintain Business Users and assign the created roles.

Especially take care of providing the same information about user propagation then configured in the step 2.1. by inserting the email address in the provided field.

If you have decided for email as subject name identifier, here the E-Mail needs to be inserted. If you have opted for Login Name, the User Name that is chosen needs to correspond the BTP Login Name.
You see as well User ID which would be available. Do not use User ID for user propagation as it is a technical name! However this CB* User would be needed for SAP Customer Support Cases to provide for SAP Support or visible in System Administration apps, both are not needed now. 

6. Step 3.2. — Prepare the S/4HANA Public Cloud side with Communication System, Arrangement  and Communication User

Now go on creating the communication scenarios by creating Communication User, Communication System and Communication Arrangement.

1. Create a Communication User for GRDC

 

 
This is straightforward. You can give the user a meaningful name corresponding to GRDC or referring to the communication arrangement 0241 as there might be several ones connection different Products and Systems. You see that the user ID starts with CC other then the Business User which start with CB. This user ID starting with CC can be selected in Communication Traces later for Troubleshooting.
Note down the User name.

2. Open Communication Management → Communication Systems

3. Create a new Communication System for BTP integration:

  • Hostname: use the full qualified hostname that you obtain from the BTP cockpit . Select the Subdomain name and add it to this FQDN (fully qualified domain name): [subdomain_name].grdc-sap.cfapps.[region_name].hana.ondemand.com -> Here ccon-XXX.grdc-sap.cfapps.eu10.hana.ondemand.com

 
S/4HANA Public Cloud side:
 
Beware of typos, there is no input validation check!
 
Still in the Communication System we come to the place where we link the S4/HANA system trust with the BTP sub-account. To set up this parameter, we need to download the certificate of our GRDC BTP sub-account.

 

Go to BTP Cockpit ->

Go to the BTP account. 

  • From the left column, choose Destination-> Destination Trust. 
  • Choose Export  -> Download file to a location

 

S/4HANA Cloud side:

Go the the Communication System in S/4HANA Public Cloud

  • In the Communication System under OAuth 2.0 Identity Provider, select the Enabled checkbox.
  • Upload the downloaded file in the OAuth 2.0 Identity Provider section.
  • The OAuth 2.0 SAML Issuer must match the Common Name (CN) of the Signing Certificate Subject.
Possible Pitfalls:
 
The Oauth 2.0 SAML Issuer Field above should contain the value of CN from certificate.

 

BUT IMPORTANT: it should not contain the leading letter "CN=" !

 For Inbound and Outbound Communication: Enter the previously created communication user and use the generated password.

 

Click: SAVE

 4. Create a Communication Arrangement (Communication Management → Communication Arrangements): Click on „New“ and choose SAP_COM_0241

Add the communication system that you created in step 2 in the mandatory field „Communication system“.

It is adding already all relevant services for Inbound (if BTP calls S/4HANA)

 

And Outbound (if S/4HANA calls BTP)

The Inbound Communication user will be added as well from the Communication system. — if BTP calls S/4HANA. It should not be changed.

 

 
The Outbound user (S/4HANA calls BTP ) was also taken from the Communication system and should not be changed. The authentication method should be User ID and Password.
In the section: "Common data" note down the  "API -URL " for later use in the BTP Destination.

 

 
You see here as well that the Service URL was taken from the Field „Host“ in the Communication System. 
 
If there is no slash "/" at the end, add it in all fields.

 

In the Inbound User Section:

Click on „OAuth 2.0 Details” (these appear once you have saved)

The Token Service URL is important and needs to be saved for later use in the BTP Destination.
 
Now you have finished the S/4HANA Cloud side.

 

You would need the following information to proceed with the BTP side:

Note down the S/4HANA API base URL and the Token service URL in the arrangement from the OAuth 2.0 Details.

7. Step 4 — Prepare the BTP Side (Users and Destinations)

Step 4.1.  Create Roles and and assign Roles to Users

Go to SAP BTP Cockpit -> Subaccount -> Role collection -> Create 

Use an own name e.g. GRDC Roles and assign all template roles.

Here is a list of Roles that are enough for testing. Later a more refined authorization concept is needed. Note that roles must be assigned on SAP BTP and on SAP S/4HANA Side respectively. They servce different purposes and the assignement is mandatory.

Go the the left menue of the SAP BTP Cockpit to "Users".

Create Users , in our example you have to enter the User name via email, the Identity Provider which supplies the user information and an E-mail address:

This entries may vary according to the setup of your Identity Provider.

Save and go inside the User configuration to:  Role Collection and assign the previously created Role collection.

Now these users are set. 

Step 4.2 .  Create BTP Destinations

A destination lets your BTP app call S/4HANA endpoints securely.

In SAP BTP Cockpit → Subaccount → Connectivity → Destinations click New Destination.

1. Destination:  Name it S4HanaCConsoEndpoint  (standard name, exact spelling)

GRDC uses “OAuth SAML Bearer Assertion” as authentication type. Fill in the details like explained in this tables:

 
 
 
 
 
 
In the BTP Cockpit it looks like this:
There is now an extra section of SAML Properties that were previously in the section „Additional Properties“with Drop Down Menu

 

Here is the technical link name identifier for user authentication between SAP BTP and S/4HANA Public Cloud
 
nameIdFormat must have one of two values , if it has no entry that as a default the format "unspecified" is taken. 
 
If in the IAS admin page  the "Subject Name Identifier" was set to Email Address, then the "Default Name ID Format" should be "Email".
- urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.1:nameid-format:emailAddress

If in the IAS admin page the "Subject Name Identifier" was set to Login Name, then the "Default Name ID Format" should be "Unspecified". 

- urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.1:nameid-format:unspecified 
 
Verify spelling!

Please doublecheck in this documentation as this setting depends on your overall IdP policy  https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-identity-services/cloud-identity-services/configure-subject-name-identifier-sent-to-application

Save and wait 5 Minutes before Check Connection as there is a 5 minute cache when saving new configuration.

Checking the connection with the „Check“ button of the destination only means that the S/4HANA host is technically reachable. It will not check principal propagation! This can only be done by entering the GRDC Apps.

 2.  Second BTP Destination: S4HanaCConsoEndpoint_API  (standard name, exact spelling)

Use the S/4HANA communication user and password created for this destination.

Save and wait 5 Minutes before Check Connection as there is a 5 minute cache when saving new configuration.

Checking the connection with the „Check“ button of the destination only means that the S/4HANA host is technically reachable. It will not check principal propagation! This can only be done by entering the GRDC Apps

8. Step 5 — Deploy & test the GRDC app against S/4HANA Cloud

  1. Go to the Fiori Launchpad, there should now be visible the SAP Group Reporting and SAP Group Reporting Data Collection related apps  and open the Group Reporting App „Enter Global Parameters“. The business user needs to have the global parameters set before calling GRDC Apps. This means that SAP Group Reporting needs to be set up but you can set delivered entries for Period, Time, Version and Chart Of Accounts. Save.
  2. Open the GRDC  APP Define packages  and log in with your business user — you should authenticate via IAS/IDP. Choose Manage Forms or Manage Packages to test the Logon and authentication,

     

  3. Run a sample Form in Enter Package Data that requires reading/writing data to S/4HANA

9. How to request consulting

  1. Should you require assistance with the setup and configuration SAP Group Reporting Data Collection, we recommend consulting. Contact your SAP Account via this KBA 2626344 - Who is the SAP Account Manager for my company? 

12. References & further reading

  • SAP Help Portal — SAP Group Reporting and Data Collection
  • Administration Guide
  • SAP Help Portal — SAP BTP: Destinations and Connectivity
  • SAP Help Portal — SAP Identity Authentication Service documentation
  • SAP Community: Articles about S/4HANA Public Cloud Group Reporting and Group Reporting Data Collection
  • Onboarding Material for BTP
